document_notes.text:
This update for zlib fixes the following issues:

CVE-2016-9843: Big-endian out-of-bounds pointer

CVE-2016-9842: Undefined Left Shift of Negative Number (bsc#1003580) 

CVE-2016-9840 CVE-2016-9841: Out-of-bounds pointer arithmetic in inftrees.c (bsc#1003579)

Incompatible declarations for external linkage function deflate (bsc#1003577)
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: inftrees.c in zlib 1.2.8 might allow context-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact by leveraging improper pointer arithmetic.

notes.text: The inflateMark function in inflate.c in zlib 1.2.8 might allow context-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving left shifts of negative integers.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: The crc32_big function in crc32.c in zlib 1.2.8 might allow context-dependent attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving big-endian CRC calculation.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
